current_portfolio.thesis: Gold is surging (+9.6% 1mo) in a weakening dollar environment with persistent inflation. Central bank buying continues unabated globally, and real rates remain historically low. With S&P valuations stretched at 27.86x P/E, gold serves as essential portfolio insurance. The breakout above prior resistance suggests momentum continuation toward $500.

Energy is the strongest sector (+11.3% 1mo, RS +13.8) with oil at $77.82 (+11.6%). XOM offers best-in-class capital discipline, 3%+ dividend yield, and premier Permian/Guyana assets. The company's $60B+ Permian acquisition creates unmatched scale advantages. In an inflationary regime, integrated majors historically outperform. Share buybacks provide downside support.

Copper is the standout commodity (+14.6% 1mo) driven by AI data center power demand and EV adoption. FCX is the largest publicly traded copper producer with premium assets (Grasberg). Supply deficits are structural as new mine development lags. Materials sector strength (RS +12.6) confirms institutional rotation. The electrification megatrend makes copper the new oil.

KO just hit a 52-week high breakout at $73.98, confirming consumer staples leadership (+5.6% 1mo). This is the ultimate defensive compounder with 60+ consecutive years of dividend increases. Pricing power remains intact, and international markets drive growth. In an expensive market with elevated uncertainty, KO provides stability and income. 3%+ dividend yield with growth.

ISRG is severely oversold (RSI 7.2) presenting a rare buying opportunity in the undisputed leader of surgical robotics. The da Vinci platform has an installed base of 9,000+ systems globally with 80%+ market share. Recurring revenue from instruments and services provides stability. Healthcare is defensive, and robotic surgery adoption is a secular tailwind. The technical setup screams capitulation.

GSK broke to 52-week highs at $51.31 signaling institutional accumulation. Post-Haleon spin-off, GSK is a focused biopharma with a rebuilt pipeline. Trading at ~10x forward earnings with a 4%+ dividend yield, valuation is compelling vs US healthcare peers. The RSV vaccine Arexvy is a blockbuster, and oncology pipeline has multiple near-term readouts. International diversification at a discount.

Berkshire is the ultimate all-weather holding. Buffett has accumulated $300B+ in cash/Treasuries earning 5%+, suggesting patience amid expensive markets. Insurance operations generate float for investment, while wholly-owned businesses (BNSF, BHE) provide stability. Zero dividend means tax-efficient compounding. This is a diversified conglomerate in one stock - perfect for an uncertain environment.

In an inflationary regime, TIPS (Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities) provide principal protection against CPI increases. With commodities surging across the board and the dollar weakening, inflation expectations may rise. TIPS offer positive real yields while protecting purchasing power. This adds bond exposure while aligning with the inflationary macro thesis.

notable_politician_trades.insight: Large position in AllianceBernstein - unusual choice suggests confidence in asset management sector or specific knowledge
Sold $1M-$5M then repurchased smaller amounts - may be tax-loss harvesting or repositioning at better price
Healthcare committee insight? LLY is obesity drug leader - may signal confidence in regulatory environment
IREN is Bitcoin mining/AI infrastructure - may signal pro-crypto policy expectations
